maml:description.maml:para: Gets a storage file server.
The **Get-StorageFileServer** cmdlet gets the specified storage file server or all discovered storage file servers.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a [New-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966) cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of friendly names of file servers. Some servers may assign a default friendly name that users cannot modify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a [New-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966) cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of unique IDs of file servers.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the Storage subsystem.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a [New-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966) cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of friendly names of file servers. Some servers may assign a default friendly name that users cannot modify.
Specifies the Storage subsystem.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of unique IDs of file servers.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

maml:introduction.maml:para: This command gets all file servers known by the current system.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 2: Get a file server by name ---------

maml:introduction.maml:para: This command gets the file server named MyFileServer and uses the pipeline to send it to Format-List, which displays its properties.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an access point for a remote file share.
The **New-FileShare** cmdlet creates an access point for a remote file share.
The file share that this cmdlet creates represents a Server Message Block (SMB) or Network File System (NFS) share, which is on top of a MSFT_Volume.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a [New-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966) cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Indicates whether the file share is continuously available.
Specifies a user-friendly description of the file share.
Indicates whether to encrypt the data on transport.
Specifies the name of the file server to host the file share.
Specifies the name of the file share to create.
Specifies the file sharing protocol. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- NFS - SMB
Specifies the relative path. Specify this parameter if the path for the new file share is not the root of the volume.
Specifies the source volume.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The default is the current session on the local computer.

Indicates whether to encrypt the data on transport.

Specifies the name of the file share to create.
Specifies the file sharing protocol. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- NFS - SMB

Specifies the source volume.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Create an SMB file share ---------

maml:introduction.maml:para: ``` PS C:\>$Pool = Get-StoragePool -FriendlyName "clusteredpool" PS C:\> $Volume = $Pool | New-Volume -FriendlyName "myvol" -UseMaximumSize $True PS C:\> New-FileShare -Name "Docs" -FileServerFriendlyName "scaleout-clus" -SourceVolume $Volume -IsContinuouslyAvailable $True -Protocol SMB ```
The first command gets the specified storage pool, and then stores it in the $Pool variable.
The second command creates a volume using the storage pool in $Pool, and then stores it in the $Volume variable.
The third command creates a continuously available SMB file share using the volume in $SourceVolume.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a file server.
The **Remove-StorageFileServer** cmdlet removes a storage file server. This cmdlet operates on scale-out file server implementations only.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a [New-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966) cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the friendly name of the file server to remove.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies a storage file server.
The **Set-StorageFileServer** cmdlet modifies a storage file server.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Set the friendly name of a file server ---------

maml:introduction.maml:para: ``` PS C:\>Set-StorageFileServer -HostName "Costoso-Sales" -FriendlyName "Data files for the Sales operation" ```
This command sets the friendly name of a file server to Data files for the Sales operation.
